item.title: ASKA: Beginner Tips and Tricks
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Character Customization and Marking Your Entry
  • Gathering Supplies
  • Manufacturing Tools and Crafting
  • Settlement Sites
  • Understanding Villagers
  • Defending The Settlement

ASKA is a new entry to the list of Survival Games. Developed by Sand Sailor Studios, this game takes place on a Viking-inspired island. In a world filled with myth and danger, survival hinges on your planning and wits. In addition, you need to fight enemies, craft tools, and build a shelter to stay alive. While some players might find it easy to start their journey in ASKA , others might need some help to get into the groove. If you’re having a hard time getting started, this guide is for you. Here are all the tips and tricks you need to know to get better at ASKA .

Character Customization and Marking Your Entry

Before you start your adventure, you’ll need to create and personalize your character. Select the gender of the character (Male being Ragnar and Female being ASKA) and customize your appearance.

You cannot change the character’s gender or visual appearance once you’ve customized it. So, choose wisely.

The game starts near a shipwrecked boat on a beach where you can roam freely. However, you only start with the clothes you’re wearing and a flimsy water container. The beach where you land will be your respawn point at the beginning of the game. Once you’ve completed building The Eye of Odin, it will be your new respawn point.

If the Eye of Odin is demolished, the respawn point will switch to the Shipwreck again.

Keep an eye out for blue shinny crystals in the boxes near the wreck site. You’ll discover Jotun Blood, a resource that will help you call villagers to your camp.

Gathering Supplies

It really goes without saying that you need to gather various resources to survive in survival games. In ASKA , you’ll need food, water, and various materials to craft tools.

Using your special ability, you’ll find Mussels, which are food items typically found around large stones on the beach. Since they are limited in quantity, it’s better to use them wisely.

Food will go bad if it isn’t stored properly. Collect up to 30 Mussels for initial battles, as gathering more might lead to unnecessary waste.

You will come across a few enemies called “Wisps”. They are weaker than others, but cannot be defeated without a proper weapon. It’s recommended to run away from them as soon as you get food.

Collect small stones (40 stones Recommended). Once you’ve gathered the necessary resources, find Dwarf Spruce and Flax, which will provide Fiber and Sticks. To craft the Stone Axe, obtain two of each.

Manufacturing Tools and Crafting

You’ll need tools to progress further in the game. Once you’ve collected the resources, open up the Build Menu and select the tools you want to build. For instance, to create a Stone Axe, you’ll need to craft a piece of Rope. You can create it using the Fiber you have obtained. The small stones will be used to craft the stone blade.

Using your Axe, you can chop down trees such as the Young Fir to collect more resources. The Young Fir will provide you with items such as Resin, Long Sticks, and Bark. You can use these to craft more tools. Here is a list of items you should craft at the beginning:

  • Stone Axe
  • Wooden Hammer
  • Flimsy Club
  • Simple Torch
  • Stone Knife
  • Flimsy Shortbow

These weapons can all be crafted using Sticks, Rope, Resin, and Stone Blades. While they are durable, that doesn’t mean they can’t break.

Settlement Sites

Once you’re done with crafting tools and collecting resources, it’s time to locate a suitable place to live. You’ll start with a very basic camp and can upgrade to a fully functional society in no time.

When choosing a place, you have to be very careful. There are certain factors you have to look out for that will determine the standard and safety of your settlement. Here is a list of locations that could be ideal for your Settlement:

Cave Stone

This is the only source of Iron Ore in the game, so building a settlement around it wouldn't be a bad idea.

Enemy Spawners

Steer clear of creepy-looking trees with enemies around them as they are enemy spawners. Building a settlement around such a location makes you prone to enemy attacks as they will keep spawning, making you prone to enemy attacks.

Shore

Building a settlement next to the beach gives access to resources such as Mussels, Reeds, and other important items. Villagers can also fish here for food.

When you’re done finding a location for your settlement, start building it. Here is a list of all the buildings you need to build for your Settlement in exact order:

  • Simple Fire (Upgrade it to Campfire).
  • Rain Collector.
  • The Well.
  • Shelter (You can sleep and regain health in the shelter).
  • The Eye of Odin (Will act as your respawn point).

Understanding Villagers

Now is the time to bring your people to your settlement. Remember the five Blue Crystals you gathered at the start of the game? You'll be using those to attract your new citizens.

Navigate to The Eye of Odin, place the five Jotun Blood pieces inside and press the Activate button. This initiates the process of summoning the villagers.

You’ll be given an option between two villagers, both with their pros and cons, so choose wisely.

It takes about 10 minutes before your first villager comes to the settlement. It is your responsibility to provide them with a house and work. You can lend Shelter to crash in and assign the villagers to help with any of the buildings via the Settlement menu.

The citizens of the island will use tools to continue with their assignments and ensure the supply of tools is constant as their tools will lose their durability over time. Nevertheless, if you don’t assign a job to a villager, they will work randomly in any building under construction. It is recommended to let them do this at the start of your gameplay.

The villagers share the same basic needs as you do: food, water, health, and heat. They will also take breaks to rest. Meeting these needs contributes to their "Morale" meter. Keeping your workers happy boosts their morale, while neglecting their needs can have the opposite effect.

Villagers can die from being overworked or if their needs are not fulfilled.

Defending The Settlement

If you have followed all the steps, you’ll have a total of 10 buildings and two villagers in your settlement. Now it’s time to strengthen the defense of your village. Keep in mind invasions may take place at any time during the game, which is why you’ll need to ensure you have backup to fight.

Start by building the Barracks throughout the settlement. Each Barrack has a radius keeping things in its surroundings well protected. It's advisable to build multiple Barracks around the camp for comprehensive defense coverage.

The Barracks can hold up to three villagers, each equipped with Clubs and Shields crafted at the Workshop Pit to fend off enemies. To bolster your military strength, aim to enlist as many villagers as possible. Having a minimum of 12 villagers in the army is advised for optimal defense.

Once a villager dies in battle, they will not respawn. To safeguard your villagers, it's crucial to fortify the defenses of your settlement effectively.

item.title: Elden Ring Fan Reveals What Shadow of the Erdtree’s NPCs Look Like Without Their Armor
item.description:
Highlights

  • Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC NPCs reveal intricate character models beneath intimidating armor, adding depth to the game's lore.
  • Fans are impressed by the meticulous details in NPC designs, such as Redmane Freyja's scarred face and Tanith's dancer origins.
  • Some surprising aspects, like a character named Hornsent missing horns, spark discussion on additional customization options.

Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC has some terrifying NPCs, and a dataminer has made them look significantly less intimidating by showcasing what the character models inside their armor look like. While some of these Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC NPCs have pretty basic models, others have some really interesting characteristics that resonate with their lore.

Just like the other Soulsborne games, the lore has been one of the biggest talking points of Elden Ring apart from, of course, the difficulty. The lore is so intricate at times that players only get to know part of the story from the in-game cues, and the rest is dissected by the dataminers. Recently, a dataminer revealed what's inside the armor of Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC's horrifying Divine Beast Dancing Lion boss. Now, another creator has gone a step further and dissected some more characters from the expansion.

In a new video, YouTuber and Soulsborne dataminer Zullie the Witch reveals some interesting details about the NPCs in Elden Ring . The video showcases the Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree NPCs without their armor, and it is actually quite impressive to see the amount of effort FromSoftware has put behind each of these characters, despite a lot of the features not being visible to the naked eye. Fans have been fascinated by the raw appearance many of the NPCs have, starting with Moore, with several players saying he looked exactly as they had imagined.

Elden Ring Fans Impressed With The Meticulousness Of NPC Character Models

Redmane Freyja's model is quite interesting too, as her face is scarred by Scarlet Rot. This aligns with her lore in the game, and it is quite a nice detail to have considering players don't really see what's inside the armor in the game. Players have also highlighted that one of the NPCs players find in Elden Ring 's Volcano Manor, Tanith, shares striking similarities with Dancer of Ranah, which again is quite apt considering Tanith was a dancer before becoming Rykard's consort.

That being said, there are a few surprising aspects as well. For instance, Hornsent doesn't actually have horns for some reason, but the dataminer adds that it was probably not added as the character would need a unique model altogether for that. On the other hand, fans have added that along with Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC's new hairstyle options, horn customizations should also have been added with the expansion.

item.title: Warframe: How to Farm Tennokai Melee Mods (Alchemy Mission Guide)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock Tennokai Melee Mods
  • How To Farm Tennokai Mods?
  • Understanding Alchemy Game Mode

Introduced in the Whispers of the Walls update, the Tennokai system in Warframe expands your exosuit's ability to perform a special melee attack. When using the Tennokai system, you can land heavy attacks without consuming the combo meter , allowing you to keep the pressure up when fighting.

The Tennokai system is further enhanced by a variety of Tennokai mods that modify your attack power and utility . Tennokai mods bring strategical depth to melee combat in Warframe , making melee a desirable gameplay choice. The following guide aims to help you with farming Tennokai mods easily and widen your damage-dealing abilities.

How To Unlock Tennokai Melee Mods

To unlock the Tennokai mods, you must first complete the Whispers in the Walls quest , which becomes available after the following quests: The New War and Heart of Deimos .

Once both of these quests are completed, you’ll receive a message from Loid, post which you can access the Whispers in the Walls quest from the codex on the Orbiter . Completing the Whispers of the Walls quest unlocks the following:

  • Melee Arcanes : Separate from the Tennokai mods, the Melee Arcanes allow you to install special upgrades to weapons and Warframes to boost their stats .
  • Melee Exilus Slot : Unlocks a new slot for melee weapons where you can install Tennokai mods.
  • First Tennokai Mod : Your first Tennokai mod, called the Mentor’s Legacy, to get you started with Tennokai weapon modding. Equipping the mod enables Tennokai, allowing you to execute Perfect Heavy Attacks .

How To Farm Tennokai Mods?

In total, there are six Tennokai mods, including the Mentor’s Legacy . The only way to acquire these mods for free is to farm for them in the Alchemy game mode in Sanctum Anatomica on Deimos . You can also purchase all five Tennokai mods, excluding the Mentor's Legacy, for 100 Platinum.

The Alchemy is an endless, fast-paced game mode where you must kill enemies to collect elements like cold, heat, electricity, etc . You must pick up these elemental orbs and throw them at the large spherical object called the Crucible to create a new element.

The Alchemy game mode follows a rotational reward system. Filling the Crucible and completing the conversion process deems the rotation complete. To farm Tennokai mods, you must complete four rotations of the Alchemy game mode .

The rotational reward system follows this order: AABC . Tennokai mods are farmed in rotation C.

The following table lists all farmable Tennokai mods in Warframe, including their effects, rarity, and drop rates:

Tennokai Mod Name

Effect

Rarity

Drop Rate

Condition’s Perfection

Enables Tennokai and increases the status chance by up to 100%.

Uncommon

12%

Discipline’s Merit

Enables Tennokai and creates Tennokai attack opportunities when reaching four hits.

Rare

5%

Dreamer’s Wrath

Enables Tennokai and increases the Tennokai chance, and Tennokai attack critical damage by up to 50%

Rare

5%

Master’s Edge

Enables Tennokai and increase Tennokai attack damage by up to 60%.

Uncommon

12%

Mentor’s Legacy

Enables Tennokai.

Not Applicable

Not Applicable

Opportunity’s Reach

Enables Tennokai and increases the opportunity window by 4 seconds, and Tennokai attack melee range by up to 3m.

Uncommon

12%

Understanding Alchemy Game Mode

The Alchemy game mode is an endless mission type where you’re tasked with creating a new element by combining two primary elements in a special spherical structure called the Crucible .

The primary elements include cold, heat, electricity, and toxin , which are dropped as pickups when killing enemies. These elements must be collected and thrown at the Crucible to initiate the mixing process.

When the Crucible is filled with two element types, the conversion process begins, and two new gauges: Conversion Progress gauge and Pressure gauge pop on the left-hand side of your HUD.

Additionally, the gameplay loop now changes where several yellow markers pop up on your screen , indicating distress pipes.

You must pay attention to both the Conversion Progress gauge and Pressure gauge and shoot the marked pipes to release the pressure. When the Conversion Progress gauge reaches 100%, the rotation is completed.

To farm Tennokai mods, you must rinse and repeat this process until the fourth rotation. Continuing to play after the fourth rotation pits you against challenging enemies, who further test your Warframe skills.

item.title: How To Get And Use The Carian Thrusting Shield In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Thrusting Shields are an archetype that were introduced in Elden Ring: Shadows of the Erdtree. These weapons specialize in blending defense with their attacks and being an absolute pain to predict in PvP. Between the two Thrusting shields in the game right now, the Carian Thrusting Shield is usually the better choice if you have the stats to equip it.

Finding the Carian Thrusting Shield requires a trip to the Shadow Keep's Storehouse, but after that, it's a short stroll away from a nearby Site of Grace and you'll have a new weapon for your Tarnished to use.

Carian Thrusting Shield Overview: Stat Requirements, Effects, & Skill

Silver thrusting shield embedded with glintstones. Enables the wielder to attack and guard simultaneously. Once wielded by Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight, during her sole entry into ritual combat—a demonstration of fidelity to the Erdtree

In Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree , the Carian Thrusting Shield is a new weapon of the Thrusting Shield weapon type . What makes this weapon type particularly unique is how each of its attacks can also block other attacks. This property is what makes it perfect for blocking and counter-attacking enemies even while they're in the middle of performing their own attacks.

Be aware that these attacks will also use the Thrusting Shield's Guarded Damage Negation stats like Physical damage resistance and Guard Boost. While automatically guarding during your attacks is a wonderful benefit, this also means it's possible to be Guard Broken out of your attacks.

Compared to the Dueling Shield , the Carian Thrusting Shield has better defensive stats against physical attacks, scales slightly better with Dex (73 vs 75), better Guard Boost (69.6 vs 76.8), and also scales with Intelligence. These benefits come at the cost of a heavier weight (9.0 vs 10.5) and a higher stat requirement to properly use it. However, if you have the stats and the weight to carry this shield, it'll usually outdamage the Duelling Shield because of its superior scaling.

The Carian Thrusting Shield has a mix of Standard and Piercing attacks, and weighs 10.5. It's ideal for players who want a playstyle that focuses on blocking and counter striking enemies. You can two-hand this weapon and benefit from every part of it since it can work as a shield when you're not attacking too busy stabbing enemies with it. Thanks to this weapon's guard during attacks, talismans like the Greatshield Talisman , Spear Talisman , and Curved Sword Talisman are especially useful on it.

The Deflecting Hardtear is also perfect for this weapon since you can trigger spontaneous guards through the Thrusting Shields' attacks. Since you can two-hand this weapon to block and Guard counter, you'll also benefit from the increased Guard Counter damage as well.

In PvP, using a mixture of sprinting, spinning, guarding, and attacking makes this weapon extremely unpredictable because of how similar all of these shield animations can be. The Carian Thrusting Shield's jumping light attack is also perfect to catch rolls when your opponents are trying to run away from you.

The Carian Thrusting Shield can be upgraded using Smithing Stones to +25 , and cannot benefit from spell-based or consumable weapon buffs.

Carian Thrusting Shield Stat Requirements

STR

DEX

INT

FAITH

ARC

17

13

15

0

0

Carian Thrusting Shield Damage & Scaling

Scaling (Base)

Scaling (+10/+25)

STR

D (41)

STR

C (61)

DEX

D (41)

DEX

C (61)

INT

D (30)

INT

D (54)

Carian Thrusting Shield Weapon Skill: Shield Strike

The Shield Strike Ash of War is the default skill on the Carian Thrusting Shield, but it can be changed to something more useful to your build. This Ash of War is mediocre on the Thrusting Shields because, when equipped in the off-hand, it allows you to block with the Thrusting Shield and then immediately hit enemies with a string of armored attacks. While it may be a useful trait to have for osme builds, it's something the Thrusting Shields already do when equipped in the main hand or when two-handed. If you plan on using the Carian Thrusting Shield as your main weapon, you'll want to swap this Ash of War to something more relevant.

This Ash of War is better used on a shield that you can't normally attack with. The Brass Shield is a great candidate for this Ash of War because it has 100% physical damage negation, so when you attack with the shield into an enemy physical attack you'll take no damage and your attack will still get through.

This weapon skill costs 0 FP to cast, and can be chained into two additional follow-up attacks. These follow-up attacks also cost 0 FP.

A skill that uses the shield to attack. Repeated inputs allow for up to three follow-up attacks.

Where To Find Carian Thrusting Shield Location

The Carian Thrusting Shield is found in the Shadow Keep storehouse. Start in the Storehouse, Back Section Site of Grace and head westward . Run past the ladder and you'll find a hallway with three shadow mages and a Fire Knight staring at a bookshelf. You can take out the shadow mages without alerting the Fire Knight, but once you get too close, the mages will start throwing fireballs in your direction.

If you haven't found the Storehouse, Back Section Site of Grace yet, start in the Church District Entrance Site Of Grace and head to your northwest.

Here are the steps to reach that Site of Grace:

  1. Follow the path of the roofs until you reach a large roof where you can't continue north westward,
  2. Be careful of the Fire Knight there and follow the rooftop to the southwest.
  3. Look for a slanted bar leading into the Storehouse's roof and jump across the water onto it.
  4. Head up the bar and look for an opening in the roof to land safely onto the structure below.
  5. Once you've landed on the structure, drop down one more time to the ground floor nearby.
  6. Follow that path and look for an exit that leads to a small pathway over the water in the northeast direction. Be careful, there are three Fire Knights on this floor.
  7. Once you've found the path, head down it and take the elevator up.
  8. Step out of the elevator and head to your left and the Storehouse, Back Section Site Of Grace will be right in front of you.

item.title: MultiVersus: The Rise of Jason Event Guide
item.description:
MultiVersus is a live-service video game, so there's no surprise that Season 1 of this multi-fandom brawler already has seen several events come and pass. These events offer players an opportunity to earn several different rewards, from Battlepass XP to in-game currencies, or cosmetics.

For this reason, players are often eager to participate in each event as it is worked into the game. One of the many events to arrive during Season 1 is The Rise of Jason, an event featured around Halloween slasher icon, Jason Voorhees, who is also a playable character in the game under the Tank role. To help players make the most of this event opportunity, all missions, event progressions, and rewards have been outlined in the guide below.

Updated June 26, 2024 by Grace Black: The Rise of Jason event in MultiVersus concludes on June 26. For this reason, this post has been updated with all of the missions until this date so players can attempt to progress with the little time available. Additional information regarding the dates that players can claim earned rewards until has also been featured where relevant, to ensure players make the most out of the opportunity to snag these prizes.

All The Rise of Jason Event Missions, Progressions & Rewards in MultiVersus

In MultiVersus , The Rise of Jason event began on June 18, 2024 , and will run until June 26, 2024 . During this time, players will be able to work through a series of milestones and earn rewards by completing missions. As the event progresses, additional missions will be revealed for players to complete, enabling them to make steady progressions and claim valuable goods, including a summer-themed cosmetic for the iconic Mage fighter duo, Tom & Jerry.

Some users have been experiencing a bug where they won't receive rewards or milestone progression from completed The Rise of Jason missions. This will likely resolve soon, and players should be able to receive all met rewards by the end of the event with no further issues.

The Rise of Jason Progressions & Rewards

Milestone

Description

Reward

Fire Up The Grill

In Jason's world, only the scary survive.

250x Battlepass XP

Rule 1: Never Split Up!

But that doesn't mean you always need to work together.

7500x Battlepass XP

Feeling Edgy?

Jason always keeps his machete sharp.

600x Fighter Currency

He's Been Waiting For You

Now be nice and say hello.

Summer/Swimsuit Tom & Jerry cosmetic

While The Rise of Jason event concludes on June 26, 2024, it is likely there may be a brief extended period to claim prizes, as seen in the past with the Team Batman v. Team The Joker event . Players can expect to be able to claim prizes earned during the dates of the event up until June 27, 2024, but, they will not be able to continue to progress through any further missions or milestones.
